bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. DANNY K. DAVIS of Illinois:H.R. 7297.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:To the power granted to Congress under Article I of theUnited States Constitution and its subsequent amendments, andfurther clarified and interpreted by the Supreme Court of theUnited States.[Page H10210]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Education and the Workforce.

summary.text:
Earl N. Williams, Sr., First Chance Act

This bill expands the student support services program to include grants to students at institutions of higher education for basic and emergency supplemental living assistance.

bill.title: Earl N. Williams, Sr., First Chance Act

item.title: Earl N. Williams, Sr., First Chance Act
To amend the Higher Education Act of 1965 to provide basic and emergency supplemental living assistance grants under the student support services program.
Earl N. Williams, Sr., First Chance Act

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Education and the Workforce.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
